posts.post_content: I'll tell you what it is; it is intentionally telegraphed spot removal. This makes it cheaper, yes, but better in multiplayer. They can attack you, and KNOW they'll lose their best dude, or attack your other opponent. In theory, removal, in practice, attack deterrent. Brilliant.

Posted By: Stinga (2/2/2012 1:02:50 PM)

posts.post_content:
Seal of Exile. niiiice.   
  
and by the way- exiling your own Planeswalker sounds like part of a suspiciously broken plan to me, if you have a way to bring them back. eventually, they are going to make a card (probably a rare) that returns from exile to somewhere. probably hand. it's already been proving that 'blinking' is really good on other cards. I foresee it becoming so good that they stop letting you blink with just one card, but don't want to make it impossible to do either, so instead of making blinkers they'll just make cards that exile themselves, along with a card that returns from exile. similar to idea to crazy things from Time Spiral, only depowered.  
  
I know the card doesn't do that- but people seem to think that if it did, that would be bad or something. I think they're wrong.
posts.html:

I foresee it becoming so good that they stop letting you blink with just one card, but don't want to make it impossible to do either, so instead of making blinkers they'll just make cards that exile themselves, along with a card that returns from exile. similar to idea to crazy things from Time Spiral, only depowered.
